page.title: 17St. Hilary's Tower.
page.content: For miles around the tower can be seen standing alone on the hilltop near to the church of St. Hilary. its neglected and blackened sandstone shell has become the home of wild pigeons who fly in and out undisturbed. Around the tower are old gravestones, many with little left of their message to read as they have worn away with wind and rain.A small plaque above the doorway shows the date to be 1530 which makes it the oldest building in Wallasey. The church itself was burnt down for the second time in 1857 when it was decided to leave the tower and rebuild the church on a new site nearby.
